enum.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}
Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

class.name: MoMgcf
class.description: Data for the Media Gateway Controller.

action.name: mgcAction
action.description:
This attribute holds the available O&M actions that can be performed on MGC System.
The variable has to be set to '1' to start the forced locking of the MGC.
The variable has to be set to '2' to start the graceful locking of the MGC.
The variable has to be set to '3' to start the unlocking of the MGC.
Value '4' starts to save current MGC configuration. This overwrites old xml-files.
When MGC has finished the execution of the ordered action the variable holds the value '6'.
Value '7' initiates a switchover in a HA-MGC from running as master to become stand-by. The order will only be executed if initiated from a master MGC.
Value '8' reinitiates the SS7 stack with the ISUP, M3 and BE-IF Configuration changes during Run time.
Value '9' reinitiates the SS7 stack with the E-Mtpl2-IF, Mtpl2, Communication Controller Mux Configuration changes during Run time.
Value '10' cancels the configuration changes done in for the SS7 stack modules.
While MGC executes an ordered action the variable holds the value '11'.
Value '12' reinitiates the SS7 stack with the Sctp Configuration changes during Run time.
Value '13' is used whenever a Restart Required SS7 Parameter is changed and the new value shall be taken into service.

enumRef.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

attribute.name: mgcfId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the mgcf

attribute.name: isupType
attribute.description:
SS7 protocol type selected in installation package.
o ITU : ITU-ISUP
o ANSI : ANSI-ISUP
o CHINA : CHINA-ISUP

attribute.name: mgcOperationalState
attribute.description:
Operational state of the MGC.
o Disabled (1): MGC is totally unable to provide call service, i.e. all PSTN devices are in hardware blocked state and the MGC is unable to accept calls.
o Enabled (2): MGC is partially or fully operable and available for use, i.e. at least one PSTN span is hardware deblocked and the MGC can accept calls.

attribute.name: mgcUsageState
attribute.description:
Usage state of the MGC.
o Idle(1): MGC is not currently in use (number of active PSTN and IP calls are equal to zero).
o Active(2): MGC is running traffic (number of initiated PSTN and IP calls is at least one).
o Busy(3): not supported.

attribute.name: mgcAdministrativeState
attribute.description:
Administrative state of the MGC.
o Unlocked (3): PSTN devices are unlocked and the MGC accepts new calls.
o ShuttingDown (2): PSTN devices are maintenance blocked, no new calls are accepted but the active calls are kept.
o Locked (1): PSTN devices are reseted (all active calls are released) and operator locked (no new calls are accepted).

attribute.name: mgcActiveBladeSlotno
attribute.description: Displays the slot number for the active MGC blade.

attribute.name: isrFE0
attribute.description: Displays blade name for the ISR FE instance 0, which is also known as the Mtpl2 FE Instance 0.

attribute.name: isrFE2
attribute.description: Displays blade name for the ISR FE instance 2, which is also known as the Mtpl2 FE Instance 2.

attribute.name: mgcHaState
attribute.description:
Specifies if a HA-system MGC is currently handling traffic (master) or stand-by.
o HaUnspecified (0): MGC is starting up, or not defined as a HA-MGC.
o HaMaster (1) : MGC is a master MGC handling the traffic.
o HaStandBy (2) : MGC is a stand-by MGC currently not handling traffic.

attribute.name: mgcHostName
attribute.description: The host name of MGC in node level to construct the 'node-data' in charging-info of P-Charging-Vector header.

attribute.name: mgcForeignNetworkId
attribute.description: The Foreign Network Identifier of MGC node.

attribute.name: mgcFullyQualifiedDomainName
attribute.description: This parameter defines the traffic IP address of the MGC except those used for SCTP. SCTP IP address is defined in the SCTP layer Local IP Address table.

attribute.name: priorityTrafficOnly
attribute.description:
This field determines if MGC shall reject all calls that have no priority either based on calling party's category or based on called number series.
o true : calls without priority are rejected
o false: calls without priority are not rejected

attribute.name: countryCode
attribute.description:
This attribute defines the country code (CC) of the country where MGC is located.
Valid digits are 0..9

attribute.name: workMode
attribute.description: This parameter is used to indicate whether MGC set up the SIP-SIP call by using the MGW or not. It is a node level parameter which cooperate with SIP Profile's SIP Response Code For No Common Codec when 'Smart Mode' is in use. eAlwaysUseMediaGateWay (0): This value indicates MGC establish the SIP-SIP call, always use MGW to process media message. Support audio codec transcoding. eSmartMode (1): This value indicates MGC establish the SIP-SIP call without using MGW at first. When the received SIP response code match the configured SIP Profile's SIP Response Code For No Common Codec, MGC will re-establish the call by using the MGW. Otherwise the call would be released.

attribute.name: dnsServerAddressRead
attribute.description:
This parameter defines whether the DSN server address is read from the system resolv.conf or from the 'MGC system' table.
o FromSystemResolvConf(0) : The DNS Servers IP Address is read from system configuration file, resolv.conf.
o FromMgcApplication(1) : The DNS Servers IP Address is read from the 'MGC system' table, from attributes 'Primary DNS Server' and 'Secondary DNS Server'.

attribute.name: primaryDnsServerIpAddress
attribute.description:
This variable holds the MGC's primary DNS server IPv4 address in dotted decimal format.
E.g. 0.0.0.0 - 255.255.255.255

attribute.name: secondaryDnsServerIpAddress
attribute.description:
This variable holds the MGC's secondary DNS server IPv4 address in dotted decimal format.
E.g. 0.0.0.0 - 255.255.255.255

attribute.name: localSctpPort
attribute.description: This variable holds the port number of the MGC's SCTP stack when MGC operates in server mode.

attribute.name: toneInterworkingTimeout
attribute.description:
Timeout (in milliseconds) for releasing the connection in case tone interworking (i.e. tone sending) is required by incoming route at disconnection of call.
Timer is started when tone sending from MG is started. At timeout call is disconnected.
o '0' : no tone interworking
o '1' - '90000': timeout in milliseconds
Recommended value is 15 000 ms.

attribute.name: howToTreatUdi64kCall
attribute.description:
This is information for MGC if the UDI64k (TMR) indicated calls shall be treated as multimedia or as data (clearmode) calls.
o (0) : only the UDI64k (TMR) with correct H.223/H.245 indication is treated as multimedia call. All other UDI64k indications are treated as data calls.
o (1) : all the calls indicated by UDI64k (TMR) are treated as multimedia calls, with the exception of calls where an explicit non H.223/H.245 indication (in USI, layer 1 protocol) is received. These calls are treated as data calls.
o (2) : all the calls indicated by UDI64k (TMR) are treated as data calls.

attribute.name: initialConnectionModeForVoip
attribute.description:
This attribute defines how media stream shall be through connected in MG at seizure of resources in MG for VOIP calls.
o Inactive (0) : No through connection of media stream shall be done.
o Backward (1) : Through connect media stream in backward direction.

attribute.name: pmDelay
attribute.description:
Performance Management Counter values are not real time read and this parameter determines how much delay there can be.
Range is 10000 - 300000 milliseconds, default is 10000 ms.

attribute.name: logLevel
attribute.description:
This is common log level for the MGC.
o Emergency (7): Information about an event that leads to serious failure. MGC is unable to process ANY calls or to do ANY charging. This map to Fatal level in the log file.
o Alert (6): Information about an event that also leads to serious failure. MGC is/will be unable to take FURTHER calls (new calls) or to do FURTHER charging (for new calls). This map to Alert and Fatal levels in the log file.
o Error (4): Information about an event/state that leads/will lead to an individual dropped call/failed transaction (that will affect the end-user) and is LIKELY to lead to more dropped calls/failed transactions in the near future. This map to Error, Alert and Fatal levels in the log file.
o Warning (3): Information about an abnormal event/state that does not lead to dropped call/failed transaction (that affects the end-user) but should be fixed whenever possible e.g. missing configuration data. This map to Warning, Error, Alert and Fatal levels in the log file.
o Notice (2): Significant information about call progress. Both successful and unsuccessful call-level information. This maps to Notice, Warning, Error, Alert and Fatal levels in the log file.
o Debug(0): Logging level is Debug Level. This map to DebugAll (Debug, Info, Notice, Warning, Error, Alert and Fatal levels) in the log file.

enumRef.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

attribute.name: mgcOAMLock
attribute.description:
Operation and maintenance interface for MGC configuration.
o 0 - SNMP
o 1.. - Netconf (session-id)

attribute.name: emanateIpAddress
attribute.description: This attribute shows SNMP master agent's IPv4 address. Cannot be changed during operation.

attribute.name: rlspinterval
attribute.description: Value of this attribue decided the interval between heartbeats sent by MGC blades towards the ethernet switch for purposes of diagnosing lan failures. It is read from IS common parameters and populated in MO during the boot time and LanFmMonitor uses it to set the values correctly in the bonding driver during its initialization.

attribute.name: sisIpAddress
attribute.description: This attribute is used by application to read the SNMP manager's IP address for sending traps.

attribute.name: mgcDNSCacheEnable
attribute.description: Enable/disable DNS cache should be configurable. If it's set to be disabled, DNS cache should be cleaned.

attribute.name: mgcDNSFailOverTimer
attribute.description: Timer (In milliseconds) for DNS server failover. It starts when a DNS query is sent to a DNS server. When it times out and no response is got from the DNS server, the query will be resent to the next DNS server.

attribute.name: isupTypeSIPI
attribute.description:
This attribute is used to indicate the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message supported by MGC.
In incoming side, if MGC support SIP-I and the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message is same to this parameter, the call is accepted. If the type is not same to this parameter, the call will be rejected.
In outgoing side, if MGC support SIP-I, MGC will set the ISUP type in SIP-I message according to this parameter.
eUnknownISUP(0): Indicate the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message, is unkown or not support by MGC. Used internal, not visible to user and not appear in GUI.
eITUISUP(1): Indicate MGC to support the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message is ITU-T ISUP.
eANSIISUP(2): Indicate MGC to support the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message is ANSI ISUP.
eCHINAISUP(4): Indicate MGC to support the ISUP type of ISUP MIME in SIP-I message is Chinese ISUP.
Refer to SIP Profile's Use Isup Transparency.

attribute.name: maxNonSupervisedSessionDuration
attribute.description: Session Duration Timer is started when a call is established, the call will be released when the timer expires. range: 0-48 hours default:0

attribute.name: sessionDurationTimerSwitch
attribute.description: Session Duration Timer feature can be switch on or off. Default: switch off false: switch off true: switch on

attribute.name: mgcOAMChargingIpAddress
attribute.description: This attribute is the IP address of the separate VLAN for charging.

attribute.name: mgcOAMLock2
attribute.description:
Interface lock handler.
o 0 - Netconf operation
o 42 - GUI operation

attribute.name: emergencyCallTrunkReservation
attribute.description:
The MGC must be possible to keep an adequate number of circuits to the PSTN free, whereby the free circuit of a bundle is reserved for emergency call only. To achieve this purpose, several reservation methods were implemented in MGC.
Dynamic: When this method is choosed, MGC will reserve one additional circuit (starting with 1 circuit) for emergency call per trunk group (resource group) dynamically. If this circuit is taken by an emergency call then trunk reservation will immediately reserve another circuit for emmergency call. If all circuits in the trunk group are busy then the next relased circuit is reserved for emmergency call.
Threshold: When this method is choosed, MGC will do trunk reservation for emergency call via threshold limit setting('High Water Threshold Percentage' and 'Low Water Threshold Percentage') per 'ISUP Node Connection'(a pair of one OPC and one DPC). 'High Water Threshold Percentage' means High Threshold percentage of max. number of CIC?s in use. 'Low Water Threshold Percentage' means Low Threshold percentage of max. number of CIC?s in use. MGC would proceed the call like below when circuits in used have been over the threshold. 1. When the number of circuits in used is over threshold value of 'High Water Threshold Percentage', all incoming calls from both SIP and ISUP will be rejected with cause ?circuits congestion?, except emergency calls. 2. When the number of circuits in used backs below threshold value of 'Low Water Threshold Percentage', all calls could be accepted.
None: When this method is choosed, no circuit will be reserved for emergency call.

attribute.name: supportE2ERedundancySwitch
attribute.description:
This parameter indicates whether End to End redundancy feature is enabled or not and what kind of SIP response would be sent by MGC in any one of below scenarios: a) All H.248 SCTP associations between MGC and MGWs are unavailable. b) No MGW registered to MGC. c) All MGWs are locked from MGW side. d) MGW registered to MGC but no available device is registered to MGC or no available device found during MGW audit procedure. e) All devices on all MGWs are lock from MGW side. f) All MGWs are lock from MGC side. g) All devices on all MGWs are lock from MGC side. h) All devices on all MGWs are hardware/maintenance blocked from remote PSTN exchanges on ISUP level.
true: E2E Redundancy is enabled, MGC send SIP 503 response. false: E2E Redundancy is disable, MGC send SIP 480 response.
Default value is false.

attribute.name: customizeDTMFPayloadTypeNumber
attribute.description:
MGC is able to initiate SDP offer with configured Payload Type number for telephone-event codec.
Two possible values are provided as below: 99(e99): Payload Type Number of Codec telephone-event is set to 99.
101(e101): Payload Type Number of Codec telephone-event is set to 101.

class.name: MoMgcfLog
class.description:
Data for Media Gateway Controller Log strategy:
NOTIFY,SNMP,SoftwareManager,LoadControl,ResourceControl,SessionControl,Routing,H248Stack,DeviceAgent,MsgSocket,IPSIG,SIPModule,H323,RTSPModule,RecoveryDBModule,SCTPAdaptationLayer,RadiusClient,ChargingAgent,ISUPRA,ISUP,SS7Config,LanFmMonitor,IPC,RedundancyManager,PmMonitor,TCAP,DiameterAgent,CotAgent

attribute.name: mgcfLogId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the mgcfLog

attribute.name: moduleName
attribute.description: The parameter specifies the MGC module name.

attribute.name: logLevelForModule
attribute.description: The parameter specifies the log level for the module.

enumRef.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

class.name: MoMgcfTrace
class.description: Data for Media Gateway Controller trace settings.

attribute.name: mgcfTraceId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the mgcfTrace

attribute.name: callTraceReference
attribute.description: This is a string which should be unique in all the trace records.

attribute.name: callTraceOriginatingUserID
attribute.description: The Originating User ID for Trace session.

attribute.name: callTraceTerminatingUserID
attribute.description: The Terminating User ID for Trace session.

attribute.name: callTraceLevel
attribute.description: Level for call trace, can be eTraceAll or eTraceNotice.

attribute.name: callTraceTimeout
attribute.description: the timer is for Call Trace Timeout, unit is second.

class.name: MoSystemLoadRate
class.description: The CPU load and memory usage setting for the services provided by MGC.

attribute.name: systemLoadRateId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the systemLoadRate

attribute.name: loadService
attribute.description: Specifies the service for which the system load limits are configured.

attribute.name: loadCpuLoad
attribute.description: The system CPU load usage. When the CPU load is greater than the defined value, which implies the high system load, the service can be impacted. The unit is percentage.

attribute.name: loadFreeMem
attribute.description: The system free memory. When the free memory is less than the defined value, which implies the high system load, the service can be impacted. The unit is percentage.

class.name: MoNetTrace
class.description: Trace Sessions for MGC Signaling Tracing.

action.name: netTraceAction
action.description: 1) Activate the Trace Session (for reserve) 2) Deactivate the Trace Session

attribute.name: netTraceId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the netTrace

attribute.name: netTraceReference
attribute.description: The parameter is a globally unique ID provided by the OSS-RC. Trace Session Referance is divided into Country (MCC), Operator (MNC), and Trace ID. MCC: MCC is in BCD format, 3 digits in length. MNC: MNC is in BCD format, 1 to 3 digits in length, with no filler digit for MNCs less than 3 digits. Trace ID: Trace ID is in hexadecimal format, 6 digits in length, and hex letters, A to F, are capitalized.

attribute.name: netTraceOriginatingUserID
attribute.description: The Originating User ID is the E.164 representation of the (Additional) Calling Number. Defining both Originating User ID and Terminating User ID will not be mandatory; 'either of them' or 'both of them' is a valid configuration. Any other triggering events are not supported.

attribute.name: netTraceTerminatingUserID
attribute.description: The Terminating User ID is the E.164 representation of the Called Number. Defining both Originating User ID and Terminating User ID will not be mandatory; 'either of them' or 'both of them' is a valid configuration. Any other triggering events are not supported.

attribute.name: netTraceDepth
attribute.description: MGC supports the Minimum Trace depth on all the interfaces. Maximum Trace depth is supported only on the SIP interface. Other trace depth values are not supported.

attribute.name: netTraceCollectionEntityAddress
attribute.description: The Trace Collection Entity Address contains the IP address of the management system to which the trace records shall be transferred. MGC support IPv4 address only. The user ID, password, and the directory to transfer the trace records are set in the SFTP Server Configuration table for Service for NetTrace.

attribute.name: netTracePriority
attribute.description: The Trace Priority parameter is an optional proprietary parameter. The Trace Priority shall be an enumerated parameter with the following possible values: 1 - Low 2 - Medium 3 - High If the parameter is omitted, the default priority is Medium.

attribute.name: netTraceTimeout
attribute.description: The parameter specifies the duration of the trace session in seconds. When a trace session is activated, a timer with the specified timeout will be started. After the timer expiry, the trace session will be automatically deactivated and a notification with specific reason will be sent to OSS-RC. If the parameter is not specified, MGC uses a default timeout value, 24 hours, to protect MGC from indefinite trace sessions. The timeout value, 0, indicates no timer will be started and the trace session is deactivated only after the deactivation request is received from OSS-RC.

attribute.name: netTraceStatus
attribute.description: The status for Trace Session. A new Trace Session should always use status eTracing. If the status is eStopping, it means the Trace Session should be deactivated but it still have some Trace Recording session for this Trace Session, and it will be deactivated automatically when the Trace Recording Session finished.

attribute.name: netTraceHitCounter
attribute.description: Used for generate the Trace Recording Session Reference. It is hidden in the GUI.

attribute.name: netTraceStarttime
attribute.description: The time when insert the Trace Session.

class.name: MoSs7Trace
class.description: This is a trace controller for modules in SS7.

attribute.name: ss7TraceId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the ss7Trace

attribute.name: oamTrace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of OAM module in SS7

attribute.name: isupTrace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of ISUP module in SS7

attribute.name: tcapTrace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of TCAP module in SS7

attribute.name: m3Trace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of M3 module in SS7

attribute.name: sctpTrace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of SCTP module in SS7

attribute.name: mtpl2Trace
attribute.description: This enables/disables the message trace of MTPL2 module in SS7

class.name: MoMgcfIPAddress
class.description: This Table defines the IP address which will be used on MGC blade.

attribute.name: mgcfIPAddressId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the mgcfIPAddress

attribute.name: mgcfIpAddress
attribute.description: The local IP address of MGC

attribute.name: mgcfIpNetAddress
attribute.description: The IP subnet address where the local IP Address belonging to

attribute.name: mgcfIpSubnetMask
attribute.description: The Subnet Mask for the IP Address

attribute.name: mgcfIpVlanTag
attribute.description: The VLAN Tag for the Local IP Address. Format: For the first IP of one VLAN_ID, it should be VLAN_ID; next one should be VLAN_ID:Sub_ID, e.g, for the first IP of 311, it should be 311, others will be 311:1, 311:2, etc.

class.name: MoMgcfIPRouting
class.description: This table defines the static IP Routings which will be used on Os level.

attribute.name: mgcfIPRoutingId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the mgcfIPRouting

attribute.name: mgcfRoutingDestination
attribute.description: The destination host/net address for this static IP route

attribute.name: mgcfRoutingNetworkMask
attribute.description: This parameter defines the network mask for the routing destination IP address

attribute.name: mgcfRoutingNextHop
attribute.description: The next hop IP address (gateway address) for this static IP route.

attribute.name: mgcfRoutingInterface
attribute.description: Force the route to be associated with the specified device. MGC uses interface bond0 and it is not changeable. So bond0 will not present into the interface string. Only need to specify VLAN ID here. For example, if Device Interface parameter value is 311, then the interface in OS will be bond0.311

class.name: MoLoadControl
class.description: Configuration attributes for the Load Control functions in the MGC Application.

attribute.name: loadControlId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the loadControl

attribute.name: lcCapacityRequestDecrease
attribute.description:
Decrease factor for load control algorithm.
If the Moving Total Processor Load is above the maximum value (lcMinMovingTotalProcessorLoad + 2), then the number of processor capacity requests allowed to be processed during a one second interval (CAL) is decreased using this value.

attribute.name: lcCapacityRequestRejectLimit
attribute.description: Number of rejected capacity requests required during the supervision time 'Capacity Reject Supervising Time' for alarm to be generated.

attribute.name: lcCapacityRequestRejectSupTime
attribute.description: Time duration in minutes for supervising number of rejected processor capacity requests. See: 'Capacity Reject Limit'.

attribute.name: lcLoadability
attribute.description:
Minimum Moving Total Processor Load.
At beginning of each one second interval Load Control calculates 'Moving Total Processor Load', based on the weighted mean value of processor load during the 5 previous one second intervals.
LoadControl tries to keep processor load between the values:
lcMinMovingTotalProcessorLoad (equal or higher than), and lcMinMovingTotalProcessorLoad + 2 (equal or lower than).

attribute.name: lcMaxCapacityRequestsPerBuffer
attribute.description:
Maximum number of stored processor capacity requests per Load Control priority buffer.
LoadControl stores capacity requests into 16 buffers (one per the priority of the capacity request).
Number of capacity requests in each buffer is limited by the 'Max Capacity Requests per buffer' for those capacity requests that can be rejected (e.g. calls from ISUP, calls from SIP, and etc).

attribute.name: lcMaxAcceptedCapacityRequests
attribute.description:
Maximum value of Capacity Request Acceptance Limit (CAL).
Value range: 10..1000 (in number of Accepted Processor Capacity Requests per a one second interval).
CAL is the number of processor capacity requests allowed to be accepted during a one second interval.

attribute.name: lcMinAcceptedCapacityRequests
attribute.description:
Minimum value of Capacity Request Acceptance Limit (CAL).
Value range: 1..30 (in number of Accepted Processor Capacity Requests per a one second interval).
CAL is the number of processor capacity requests allowed to be accepted during a one second interval.

attribute.name: lcReleasesAllowedFactor
attribute.description:
Relation between number of Processor Capacity Requests allowed to be processed during one 'sub interval' and number of disconnections allowed to be processed during one 'sub interval'.
Value range: 2..10 (multiplication factor).
During each sub interval (see the 'Sub Interval Length') SubCAL Processor Capacity Requests are allowed to be processed.
'Releases Allowed Factor' * SubCAL = The number of disconnections allowed during one sub interval.
Default value: 2

attribute.name: lcSubIntervalLength
attribute.description:
Length of Load Control subinterval.
At beginning of each one second interval the number of processor capacity requests to be processed during the next 1 second interval (CAL) is calculated.

attribute.name: lcSDPStorageThreshold
attribute.description: Define the threshold of SDP storage. The threshold is defined as the percentage of max SDP SDR size. If the number of SDP SDR exceed the threshold, MGC will reject the incoming call setup request.

class.name: MoAutomaticCongestionControl
class.description: Configuration data for MGC Automatic Congestion Control functionality.

attribute.name: automaticCongestionControlId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the automaticCongestionControl

attribute.name: accCongestionLevelFilteringTime
attribute.description:
Values (1..60): Number of consecutive times consistently higher or lower Congestion Level (CL) Congestion must be detected (detected once per second) in order to obtain reliable change of the current Congestion Level.
Value 0: No supervision of Congestion Level is done. Congestion Level is set permanently CL0 (No congestion).

attribute.name: accCongestionLevel1Limit
attribute.description: Filtered (see Congestion Level Filtering Time) delay in processing processor capacity requests to indicate congestion level 1 (CL1) to Automatic Congestion Control System (ACC).

attribute.name: accCongestionLevel2Limit
attribute.description: Filtered (see Congestion Level Filtering Time) delay in processing processor capacity requests to indicate congestion level 2 (CL2) to Automatic Congestion Control System (ACC).

action.name: pmAction
action.description:
1) Stop all Pm Monitor tasks.
Stop and lock all tasks.
2) Test File Transfer.
First set and apply needed parameters.
After that, test transfer.
In case of success, a file (either test_ftp, test_sft or test_scp) is stored into destination directory.

attribute.name: pmId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the pm

attribute.name: pmIpAddress
attribute.description: The IP address of the target host where the PM Monitor reports will be stored.

attribute.name: pmDirectory
attribute.description: The directory on the target host, which stores the PM monitor reports.

attribute.name: pmUserid
attribute.description: The account name to be used to store the PM monitor reports into the target host.

attribute.name: pmPassword
attribute.description: The password for the user ID.

attribute.name: pmCPULoad
attribute.description:
The system load average in a one-minute period of time.
If the actual system load average exceeds the defined value, PM monitor tasks will be revoked or stopped according to priority settings.
The unit is percentage. The range is from 0 to 90 and the default value is 87.

attribute.name: pmFreeMem
attribute.description:
The amount of the system free memory.
If the amount of system free memory is less than the defined value, PM monitor tasks will be revoked or stopped according to priority settings.
The unit is percentage. The range is from 0 to 20 and the default value is 10.

attribute.name: dnPrefix
attribute.description: A Distinguished Name is used to uniquely identify a node, and is composed of prefix and bs id in MGC. The definition of Distinguished Name Prefix must obey the rules defined in 3GPP TS 32.300.

class.name: MoPmTasks
class.description: PM Monitor Tasks parameters and actions.

action.name: pmTasksAction
action.description:
Action
Enable - resume or start initially a job
Disable - suspend a job
Stop - stop a job

attribute.name: pmTasksId
attribute.description: The MoClass key of the pmTasks

attribute.name: pmJobName
attribute.description: The name of a PM monitor task. The Job Name must be unique.

attribute.name: pmFamilyId
attribute.description: The performance measurement family to be monitored.

enumRef.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

attribute.name: pmTasksAdministrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the PM monitor task. Once a task is created, the administrative state is on. The Stop and Suspend actions change the state to Off. The Resume action changes the state to On.

attribute.name: pmTasksUsageState
attribute.description:
The status of the performance monitor task.
- Active: The job is running.
- Scheduled: The job is scheduled to be activated when it reaches Start Time.
- Idle: The job is stopped by the operator or due to the heavy load or low free memory, or it reaches End Time.
- Suspended: The job is paused by the operator or due to heavy load or low free memory.

attribute.name: pmStartTime
attribute.description: The time when the job starts. Local time is used. The default value means the job starts immediately.

attribute.name: pmEndTime
attribute.description: The time when the job ends. Local time is used. The default value means the job keeps running all the time.

attribute.name: pmGranularity
attribute.description:
The granularity period defined by 3GPP PM IRP.
The period can be 5, 15, or 30 minutes, or 1, 12, or 24 hours.

enumRef.name: Sequence {IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>, IN6!<unnamed>}

attribute.name: pmValueFormat
attribute.description:
This parameter specifies delta or absolute values to be collected in the report.
- true: Delta values to be collected. This format is not valid for gauges.
- false: Absolute values to be collected. This is the default value.

attribute.name: pmReportPeriod
attribute.description:
This parameter determines the interval of transferring the performance monitor reports to the directory on the target host. It is a number of the granularity periods.
For example, if Granularity is 5 minutes and Report Period is 3, then the reports will be transferred every 15 minutes.
Note: The value of Granularity (min) multiplied by Report Period must be less than or equal to 24 hours, that is, 1440 minutes.

attribute.name: pmTasksPriority
attribute.description:
The priority of the performance tasks.
- Medium: During the high system load or low free memory, the job will be suspended by the system.
- Low: During the high system load or low free memory, the job will be stopped by the system.
- High: The job keeps running even if the system load becomes high or the free memory becomes low.

attribute.name: pmCollectionBeginTimeReset
attribute.description:
Define if the 'measCollec beginTime' value will be reset or not in generating performance reports for each of measurement collection time.
o Keep First Measurement Collection Time(1): keep the 'measCollec beginTime' value as the first measurement collection time value.
o Reset to Each Measurement Collection Time(2): reset the 'measCollec beginTime' value to each measurement collection time value.

attribute.name: mediaGatewayCodecs
attribute.description: \nThe codecs support by the Media Gateway. Only applicable for MRS based IM-MGW.\n

attribute.name: mediaGatewayAllBitsAllocated
attribute.description: \nThe codecs support by the Media Gateway. Only applicable for MRS based IM-MGW.\n

attribute.name: rootId
attribute.description: The key attribute.
